sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: The EU agrees on a 10th package of sanctions against Russia, coinciding with the one-year anniversary of the war in Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky leads ceremonies in Kiev marking one year of Russia's full-scale invasion.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Ukraine's athletes forced to flee and competing for more than just medals.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The EU has agreed a new round of sanctions against Russia,

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: a decision deliberately timed to coincide with the one-year anniversary of the war in Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: It's the 10th package since President Vladimir Putin launched his invasion and introduces an export ban on industrial goods worth 11 billion euros.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: The list includes electronic components, jet engines and antennas, which Moscow will struggle to replace.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: For the first time, the E.U. is also extending the sanctions to entities linked to Iran's Revolutionary Guard, targeting those involved in the EU is also extending the sanctions to entities linked to Iran's Revolutionary Guard, targeting those involved in the production of drones that the Kremlin is using in Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: The blacklist has finally been expanded to include individuals and entities that are responsible for illegal deportations of Ukrainian children.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_16
sentences.sentence: The European Commission says that the pressure on Russia will continue. Russia is falling backwards towards an autarkic economy cut away from the world. Our sanctions are eroding sharply its economic base, slashing any prospect to modernize it. We will continue to put pressure on Russia and on those supporting it on the battlefield.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: But the negotiations to reach the agreement on the 10th package of sanctions were not simple.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Some countries, including Poland, wanted more.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: They were asking for Russia's nuclear sector to be included, as well as a ban on synthetic rubber that is used in tire production.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: The importation of Russian diamonds is also not on the list, something Belgium is opposed to.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: On the opposite side, Hungary was fighting to exclude several Russian names from the blacklist, but ultimately failed.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: A year on from Russia's invasion, Ukraine and its leadership are still standing.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: President Volodymyr Zelensky led the morning ceremony marking the outbreak of the war.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Moscow's aim was to topple his government and conquer the nation within days.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Zelensky said the Ukrainian people stopped that from happening. Слава усім, хто зараз в бою. Слава усім вам, хто допомагає щоденно битися і хто рятує життя.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: На вулицях Києва люди звернулися на рік відрізняння, життя та втрат.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Для мене цей день розділив життя, як вже сказали, до і після. Я рік не була вдома, я рік не бачила свою родину. I have not been home for a year, I have not seen my family for a year, so for me it is a terrible pain.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: I already hope that we will not have the next anniversary. I believe that this year we will end the war. As Ukraine enters a second year of war, people seem united and determined to fight on.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: enters a second year of war, people seem united and determined to fight on. But with both sides preparing for a new offensive, there's little hope of the conflict ending any time soon.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Immigration for Action is one of thousands of Russian companies registered in Georgia after Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: It helps Russians who fled mobilization find houses, adapt to their new environment and learn a new language.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: I myself am taking a course in Georgian, which we recently started.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: And today we have this super-use of popularity.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: We ended up here because the war has begun in Russia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: On the one hand, I don't want to live in a state that I think, and our team thinks, is in fact fascist, which has attacked another country.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: A year on from the invasion, there are new cafes and entertainment venues in Tbilisi with a mainly Russian clientele.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: entertainment venues in Tbilisi with a mainly Russian clientele. And there are Russian bookstores too, such as Itaka Books.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: I first visited Georgia in 2017, that is, five years ago.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: I liked the word Tbilisi.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: I came to Tbilisi, I walked around for three hours and realized that I no longer love Moscow. I love Tbilisi. I want to live in Tbilisi, I came here for three hours and I realized that I don't like Moscow anymore.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: I love Tbilisi. I want to live in Tbilisi.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: მესივიდების მესივიდების მესივიდების მესივიდების მესივიდების მესივიდების მესივიდების მესივიდების მესივიდების მესივიდების მესივიდების მესივიდების მესივიდების მესივ According to official data, about 1.5 million Russian citizens have crossed the Russia-Georgia border since the war started.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: How many have stayed is not known.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The influx worries many in Georgia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: A recent survey found 70% of Georgians thought the arrival of Russians would negatively impact the country, and they supported imposing a visa regime on their northern neighbor.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Different parts of the world are marking the first anniversary of the Russian invasion of Ukraine with vigils.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: People gathered at this one in London's Trafalgar Square to show their support for those still living in the war-torn country.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: We speak to them, we ask about the situation in Ukraine, we support them.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: So they need emotional, psychological support, but also we learn from them how to be strong.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: They tell us, guys, we will win.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: So they tell us, don't worry, just help, give us help as much as you can and we will stay strong, we will win.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: In Brussels, the Ukrainian flag colours lit up the buildings of the European institutions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: In Paris, the Eiffel Tower also lit up in yellow and blue, as well as the Parliament building in Portugal.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The support and solidarity on the first year anniversary of the invasion also came from the other side of the Atlantic.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: In New York, dozens of people gathered in front of the Russian consulate to protest against the war.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: A year ago, Putin started a war against Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: I have family in Ukraine, I have family in Russia, and I'm against Putin.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: I'm against what he's doing.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: I'm against him taking the territories that do not belong to him.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Most of the world seems to stand in solidarity with Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: There's no end in sight yet.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: However, according to recent polls, Europeans and Americans share the goal of Ukraine victory, even if this means prolonging the war.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Every two minutes at least one woman dies due to complications during pregnancy or childbirth.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: A new UN agency's report has analyzed data from 2016 to 2020.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The study found that the maternal mortality rate in sub-Saharan Africa is more than double the global average. And in Europe and North America, maternal deaths increased by 17% over the same period. But that figure is relatively low, according to the World Health Organization scientist Jenny Creswell.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: It's important to remember that in terms of the absolute burden, it's not so much within the European region. And many of these kind of relative increases, they're relatively small, they're small in absolute terms, because the overall level of mortality is low.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: However, several European countries have seen the number of deaths rise into double digits. And while reduced access to medical services during the coronavirus pandemic may have been a factor, it doesn't fully account for the rise. I would say that we think that COVID-19 contributed, but it does not explain the stagnation because these stagnations we've been talking about, they do predate 2020 by several years.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Most deaths experts emphasize can be prevented.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Progress is threatened by the underfunding of primary health care systems, lack of trained health workers and weak supply chains for medical supplies.
